Topic.Title: Wow - NYX sold for 34% premium

Message.Msg: 8,358,284 shares of nvidia were sold today. And $12.64 was all it was worth at the closing bell. That's it boys. $12.64 Which isn't bad for a $10 buck stock. In a struggling PC parts maker. That got it's 4Q and FY 2014 estimated sliced today. Due to "continuing lackluster demand for personal computers."

Topic.Title: While the Market rallies, nvda is struggling in the La Brea Tar Pits

Message.Msg: "NVDA was up and showed impressive strength today." Whaaaaat? nvidia closed DOWN (-$.01) today. Showing no strength whatsoever. None. At best it could be termed "flattish". And that's being charitable, given the season and all. While competitor Broadcom (BRCM) was UP and impressive +$.31 Yes boys, just in one day. Now THAT'S what impressive strength looks like.

Message.Title: Bloomberg reported HTC working on a 12 and 7 inch Windows RT tablets
Message.Msg: Powered by qualcomm quad-core Snapdragon processor, HTC's new flagship M7 is also rumored to be powered by qualcomm processor, is Nvidia losing HTC?

Topic.Title: Bloomberg reported HTC working on a 12 and 7 inch Windows RT tablets

Message.Msg: Jeepers Best, Qualcomm is announcing a new Snapdragon-powered Windows RT tablet win each and every day now. On Tuesday it was the new Nokia 10" Snapdragon S4-powered tablet. And on Wednesday the new Dell XPS 10 Windows RT tablet -- also with the Qualcomm S4 Snapdragon inside. And today, not one but TWO Windows RT tablets for HTC. Both powered by the Qualcomm S4 Snapdragon. My my my. It looks like the tegra #3 has been kicked to the curb by many many tablet makers. Oh so many. Four (4) just this week, don't u know.

Topic.Title: NVDA down over 2%

Message.Msg: You two dopes simply don't understand the dynamics of an open market, do you? Of course NVIDIA is down more than many semi's as it has a much higher beta! See that little number next to the stock in the summary? Well, it ACTUALLY means something. The stock is almost 2x as volatile as the Nasdaq and in some cases 3x more volatile than others in the same sector. This same beta causes the same violent movement upward. You say short at 12.24 (hahahahhahaha) Sure you'll may make a few pennies but be careful because when the stock moves up it's, thanks to our new friend mr Beta, it's going to huuuuurt. Just like it did last time when you all of a sudden decided to go long.

Topic.Title: NVDA down over 2%

Message.Msg: I am not going to waste my time trying to educate you imbeciles - you deserve your fate. and yes I shorted at 12.24 and 12.35. Its small position right now. A revenue/earnings miss is coming, do some research and Tegra 4 will be a sell on news event.

Message.Title: Everybody [many at least] speaks so well of this company.. but the stock does nothing
Message.Msg: So many postive articles, and the stock acts this way?..Am I missing something? I have never seen this before, especially in technology!.......Invensense [INVN] is another

Topic.Title: Everybody [many at least] speaks so well of this company.. but the stock does nothing

Message.Msg: maybe its time to be a little skeptical its a great short term trading vehicle both long and short but not a long term buy and hold compare NVDA PEG at 1.4 with its peers, its expensive. Analysts are worried about future growth prospect and some are even projecting negative growth in future. This causes the stock to fade at resistance levels as market lacks conviction. Unless NVDA steps up and starts actually buying back stock (it has $1.2B outstanding buyback) NVDA will keep fading. Charts suggest 11.50 will be visited soon.

Topic.Title: Everybody [many at least] speaks so well of this company.. but the stock does nothing

Message.Msg: "So many postive articles, and the stock acts this way?" "Am I missing something?" What you're missing is the amount of money "someone" is spending on the paid nvidia pumper crew. It's probably unprecedented. 24/7 there is always some paid pumper here expounding upon the purported virtues of their employer. Nonstop "sunbeams" about nvidia this or nvidia that. Those "so many positive articles" don't post themselves, you know. Oh no no no. It's the nvidia paid pumper crew doing what they are paid to do. Posting hype to make the company APPEAR to be doing better than it really is. Have you noticed the total disconnect between the stories posted here, and the actual quarterly results? The paid pumper's stories here give the impression that "Everything's Fine." "Just Fine, boys." And then the quarterly results come out, -- along with Jen's (-15%) reduction in guidance -- and the Reality hits. BA BOOM !!! Thing really weren't going so fine after all. But you'd never know it from the paid propaganda stories posted on This board. I have a theory that one of the reasons that nvda has such a high beta (1.81), and is such a volatile stock -- is because of the paid propaganda campaign. And the total disconnect it creates with the Reality of nvidia's struggling situation. And that what you read here -- continual "sunbeams" about nvidia -- isn't what you're gonna get in terms of anticipated future stock performance.

Topic.Title: Everybody [many at least] speaks so well of this company.. but the stock does nothing

Message.Msg: I've seen it once before. A small but promising company called on2. Inventors of VP8 which I just saw referenced in the leaked info of tegra4. They were purchased by Google for a fraction of true value. But I'm sure we have nothing to worry about. Right? I mean it's not like Google wants to rule the world or anything! Merrrrrrrrrrry Chriiiiisssttttmas!

Topic.Title: Everybody [many at least] speaks so well of this company.. but the stock does nothing

Message.Msg: Agreed Best. The paid nvidia pumper crew for which "someone" is paying, is the modern day, digital equivalent of the carnival barking snail oil salesmen of earlier times. "Step right up boys, and see how our fine, specially formulated elixir can cure whatever ails you." When in fact, the product is totally useless. But the future Hopes, Dreams, and Anticipation that their hype created got folks to part with their hard-earned cash. So it is with the paid nvidia pumper boys. Much of the hype that they post here is exactly that -- baseless, unfounded, never-gonna-happen Lies. Like that old hype about their precious Tegra winning the Apple iPad/iPhones. For YEARS they were hyping right here on this very board that the nvidia Tegra would/could/should/might or was rumored to win the mobile Apple processor slot. Years of baseless, unfounded, never-gonna-happen Hype. And many readers here were probably suckered into buying nvda because of their hype. Hoping and Dreaming and Anticipating that the pumper boy's carnival barking would come true. But the Reality was quite different. Oh so different. Apple bought not one, but Two, semiconductor design firms, designed their own superior ARM chips -- and went into the business of making their own chips. Apple will make Two Hundred Million (200,000,000) self-designed and self-manufactured A6 processors -- just this year alone (versus just 30 million tegras sold in 2012). And Apple won't buy even one (1) tegra chip like the pumper boys were hyping. Right here on this very board. Did I mention? The paid nvidia pumper crew for which "someone" is paying, is the modern day, digital equivalent of the carnival barking snail oil salesmen of earlier times. Trying to get folks to part with their hard-earned cash. And to buy nvda -- their employer's stock.

Message.Msg: So Best? Do you think that the paid nvidia pumper boys have remorse or regret or shame or any personal sense of guilty responsibility for carnival-barking a bad stock like nvda? Yes boys, a Bad stock. According to Yahoo! Finance -- nvda is a Badly Performing stock. Look right there at the top of this very page. Click on Summary, then Key Statistics. See that part? In the upper right? Hummm? + 13.02% __ S&P 52-week Change ( -12.15%) __ Nvidia 52-week Change According to Yahoo! Finance's Key Statistics, nvidia has UNDERPERFORMED the S&P 500 by (-25.17%) For the last 52-week period. (-25.17%) during just 2012. You paid pumper boys oughta be ashamed of yourselves. Yes Ashamed. For earning money to post "sunbeams" about nvidia, 24/7. And thereby suckering folks into investing their hard-earned cash in this undeniably Bad stock. And what do you tell your Mom over Christmas dinner? Hummm? "I'm in marketing, Mom." Or the Whole Truth. "I get paid to post hype on a message board about a badly performing stock called nvidia -- which likely results in folks that read my stuff to invest in the stock -- and then lose money."
